result.execSummary:
The defendant Zeb C Ebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with victim(s) unless they consent and probation agent consents.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Cooperate with any and all condtions of mental health commitment or proceedings.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DC Jail request for sentence modification. Defendant requests a one day furlough. Court responds - you're scheduled for release next Wednesday, finish this condition time. DTE

Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court, in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews memo from DOC Agent Cassandra Downing. Deputy Schwartz indicates defendant has now provided a DNA sample.  Agent Downing indicates defendant continues to refuse to sign any releases.  Court questions whether refusal to sign those releases could result in revocation of his probation. Agent Downing not sure if defendant will be revoked or not, she'd have to discuss that issue with her supervisor. Defendant feels he has the right to refuse to sign those releases. Atty Pelrine makes statement. Defendant responds. Court makes statement to defendant, indicates to defendant he needs to sign those releases or face revocation of his probation. Defendant signs release form.
DC Jail Request for Sentence Modification - Defendant requests good time credit. Court denies request, responds - probation - condition time - no good time. DTE
from DOC agent Cassie Downing requesting a court review hearing. Court sets hearing.
Review hearing on August 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
from SPD re: defendants elgibility for their representation during the appeal process

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court with attorney Eric R. Eickhoff.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recalls case at 9:50 am.  Court questions defendant on whether he will be retaining new counsel. Defendant indicates he's contacted the public defenders office in Green Bay regarding representation. He's also talked to his financial advisor about hiring new counsel. Defendant needs some time to get new counsel in place. Court removes 3/22/16 jury trial in 15-CM-10 from the calendar. Court advises defendant he's to appear in court in person for all future court proceedings. Defendant is not allowed to call in for any more hearings. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to withdraw as attorney

Defendant Zeb C Ebel appears by phone along with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews Atty Erickson's motion to withdraw. Court orders defendant to appear in court in person within the next hour, if he doesn't show, a warrant will be issued. Court grants Atty Erickson's motion to withdraw from all pending cases.
from ADA Korb indicating she has no objection to continuance of 3/22/16 jury trial but asks that 3/10/16 hearing remain on the calendar.
to withdraw as attorney

Jury finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3.
Question from jurors
Juror selection and peremptory challenges, voir dire list, random listing report, jury seating chart, juror sign-in sheet
State Exh. 3 - certified bond, Def. Exh. 1 - photo of home of S.E., Exh. 2 - DVD of blood draw at hospital. All exhibits offered and received.
No contact direct or indirect with A.E. or her residence at 917 N. 7th Avenue.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews motion in limine filed by Atty Erickson. Discussion on motion. Court reviews offers from the State with defendant in which the defendant has rejected those offers. Court discusses some preliminary matter with counsel. Voir dire begins. Oath of Qualification given. Oath of Trial Panel given. Recess 9:45 am. Back in session 10:05 am. State/Defense give opening statements. Steven Esther testifies, sworn. Def. Exh. 1 - photo of residence of Mr. Esther.  Cross, redirect, recross. Officer Neil Dorner testifies, sworn. Cross. Def. Exh. 2 - DVD of blood draw at hospital. Redirect. Officer Derek Jennerjohn testifies, sworn. Cross. Connie Neuzil testifies, sworn. Cross. Denise Englebert testifies, sworn. State Exh. 3 - certified copy of bond. Offered and received. Cross. State rests. Jury excused for lunch. Atty Erickson will talk to his client over lunch as to whether he will be testifying or not. Court reviews jury instructions with counsel.  Recess 11:59 am. Back in session 12:54 pm. Atty Erickson indicates defendant will not be testifying today. Court questions defendant on his right not to testify, finds defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving his right to testify today. Court reviews final instructions with counsel. Defense offers Exh.'s 1 & 2. Court receives. Jury returns. Defense makes motion for dismissal. Court denies motion. Defense rests. Court gives preliminary instructions to jury. State/Defense give closing argument. State gives rebuttal argument. Court gives final instructions. Oath of Bailiff given. Jury to deliberations 1:53 pm.  State/Defense have no objection to Exh.'s 1 & 3 going to the jury if they ask for them. If they wish to view Exh. 2, we will reconvene. Recess 1:54 pm. Back in session 3:11 pm. Jury returns with verdict. Jury finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Court polls jury. Jury excused. State makes motion for judgment on verdict. Court finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3.  State/Defense agree to set off sentencing until after 15-CM-10 is resolved. Court will set OWI and PAC citation for pretrial. Atty Erickson asks court to amend defendants bond to allow him to travel to Winnebago County to fish with his father. State has no objection. Court amends bond, defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin. All other conditions remain in effect. Status 3/10/16 at 8:30 am.
State's

Defendant Zeb C Ebel appears by phone with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court indicates this matter is now in the #1 position for trial. Atty Erickson inidicates this matter will be proceeding to trial at this point, he will continue to talk to the State to try and resolve matter. Atty Erickson enters not guilty plea to the OWI and PAC citations tracking this file. Court reminds defense of jury fee if defendant is requesting a jury trial. Court won't set citations for trial until after trial for criminal matter. State will keep the amended offer open until the end of today, after that offer is withdrawn. Atty Erickson will let the court know by the end of the day whether matter is resolved or not. Bond remains in effect.
Jury trial at 02-10-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 01-28-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Erickson asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Court grants request. Bond remains in effect.
from Atty Erickson requesting adjournment as they have not received all the discovery material yet.

Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Erickson filed yesterday requesting adjournment as they haven't received the rest of the discovery material yet. State concerned that case was filed back in December 2014, doesn't seem to be going anywhere. State asks court to set matter for trial. Court grants one more adjournment. If matter does not resolve, Atty Erickson to let court know and case will be set for trial. Bond remain in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Not to leave Door, Kewaunee or Brown counties.   No contact direct or indirect with A.E. or her residence.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defense asks court to amend bond to allow defendant to travel to Green Bay. State objects. Court amends bond to allow defendant to travel within Door, Kewaunee and Brown counties only. All other conditions remain in place.

Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Erickson indicates he has not received the video discovery in 15-CM-10, would like to review that before deciding how to proceed. Atty Erickson requests a 2 week adjournment. State has no objection.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Zeb C Ebel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, cancels warrant.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Citations will continue to track criminal file. State requests cash bond with conditions. Defense gives argument on bond. Cash bond set. Court will hold motion for forfeiture of bond in abayance for now.

Letter from defendant asking court to quash bench warrant.  Court responds - no action needed by me, warrants stand. DTE

Defendant called (3:45 pm) questioning how he can get the warrant quashed. Clerk LS advised to appear in person as it is a body only warrant. Defendant indicated he's out of the state working to save money to retain an atty. Defendant wouldn't give employer or new address, only phone number. Defendant will be writing a letter to the court asking that warrant be quashed.

Defendant Zeb C Ebel not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant had called this morning asking to reschedule as he was out of town working. JA Ripp advised defendant to call in for hearing. Christina Kukert called moments before hearing indicating defendant is on an airplane and unable to call in for hearing. State requests bench warrant based on non appearance. Court orders bench warrant.
by Sue Ebel.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/09/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/21/16)
No contact direct or indirect with A.E. or her residence.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Zeb C Ebel appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 2/16/15 at 2:45 pm.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
